storyInfo: Thorns tries to escape from a group of bandits who have kidnapped him, but unfortunately, he is trussed up once more, and hung upside down from a flagpole as a warning. Within the den of thieves, the bandit leader Juana's crew disapproves of her recent decisions.

attributes.text: 'Salt is sacred. It is within the tides, within our tears.'

attributes.content: He strains his eyes in the dark waters, searching the lake bed for the faint glint of metal.
He slowly paddles forward, inch by inch, fingers outstretched in the silt, but all they find are strands of waterweeds.
The frigid waters flow past his skin and hair. Confusion sets in. He does not know how he will find that golden coin.

attributes.text: 'Don't look with your eyes. Let the water's flow tell you where to go.'

attributes.content: A voice from ashore cuts through the water. He cannot see the person's face clearly, but that gentle, friendly tone sounds reassuring.
And so he closes his eyes, feeling the water rush past him, and painting an image of the lake bed in his mind's eye.
There. A solid metal disc, embossed with a complex design, resting atop some wafting weeds.
He strokes its face before grasping it in his hand. He swims away, the stranger's face getting ever clearer as he gets closer to shore.

attributes.text: 'Did you find the coin, my boy?'

attributes.content: He unfurls his fingers, the gold coin resting on his palm. The circle on its face is bisected by a straight line. Somehow it resembles some distant horizon, one he has yet to reach.
Urgh...
attributes.name: Isidro

attributes.content: What's that smell... Finny... Salty...
attributes.name: Isidro

attributes.content: Mm... hmph...
attributes.name: Strange Creature

attributes.content: *Sigh*...
attributes.name: Isidro

attributes.content: (Sticks out tongue) Bleh...
attributes.name: Strange Creature

attributes.content: Don't lick my face, little guy, or I'll hit you.
attributes.name: Isidro

attributes.content: Mmph...
attributes.name: Strange Creature

attributes.content: Forget it. I won't have to deal with you much longer.
attributes.name: Isidro

attributes.content: Hey, chaval, your food. Eat up quick! Boss wants to see you!
attributes.name: Coarse Male Voice

attributes.content: She won't be seeing me today.
attributes.name: Isidro

attributes.content: Isidro pulls down the canvas hammock hung up in the room, wrapping it around the hard bread and half-full canister of water on the tray.
He then kicks open the chest by his side, revealing a tunnel below it.
He had been digging away at it for a full week.
The strange-looking animal crawls up and nips onto his pants. Isidro watches its saliva soak into the fabric and sighs.
I'm definitely not coming back here.
attributes.name: Isidro

attributes.content: (Whistle) Javier, can I get that blade I left here last month?
attributes.name: Fiery Woman

attributes.content: Javier!
attributes.name: Fiery Woman

attributes.content: Eh? Oh... Sorry, Teach, wasn't listening. You here for the blade?
attributes.name: Javier

attributes.content: What else? Not your sweat-stained pecs, I'll tell you that much.
attributes.name: Teach

attributes.content: You all need to stop it with the jokes, Teach.
attributes.name: Javier

attributes.content: Oh, don't be like that. Seeing you sharpening knives in the early morn is pretty much part of the landscape by now.
attributes.name: Teach

attributes.content: Look, you've drawn in a crowd... Though I don't think they're here to get their knives polished.
attributes.name: Teach

attributes.content: (Leers) Hey there, Javier!
attributes.name: Spectating Man

attributes.content: What a pain in theâ€” Here. Your blade.
attributes.name: Javier

attributes.content: We don't have much metal left for repairs, so I used other things to fix it up. You'll have to make do with it for a while.
attributes.name: Javier

attributes.content: Shell and bone? You're a real dab hand.
attributes.name: Teach

attributes.content: Wanna test it?
attributes.name: Javier

attributes.content: Got anything tough I can chop up?
attributes.name: Teach

attributes.content: I did have a hunk of dry bread... but I just gave it to the kid locked in the shack.
attributes.name: Javier

attributes.content: Waste of a perfectly good loaf.
attributes.name: Teach

attributes.content: Hey, hey, move it already! Don't you lot have anything better to do in the morning? Stop blocking the damn way!
Rus?
attributes.name: Javier

attributes.content: Oh, it's you. And here I was, thinking it was the harsh glare of dawn in my eyes.
attributes.name: Teach

attributes.content: I don't have time for you and your nonsense. Quick, Javier, let's head inside and talk!
attributes.name: Rus

attributes.content: Sounds like it's not for my ears. I'll be off then, Javier.
attributes.name: Teach

attributes.content: Seems like the fun has ended... See you tomorrow, Javier!
attributes.name: Spectating Man

attributes.content: (Quietly) Hmph...
attributes.name: Javier

attributes.content: You need to talk to Juana. She's gone mad! She's going to send us all to our deaths, and you're the only one in her crew who can keep a cool head!
attributes.name: Rus

attributes.content: And how is that new?
attributes.name: Javier

attributes.content: Over all these years, every single one of her decisions looked crazy at first, but turned out to be exactly what we needed, right?
attributes.name: Javier

attributes.content: Getting in touch with that caravan a decade ago was a huge gamble too, but here we are, making a good living selling antiques we dig out of the salt flat.
attributes.name: Javier

attributes.content: Nobody took her side back then. Everyone was too scared of those money-grubbing merchants leaking the location of our fleet to the Inquisition.
attributes.name: Javier

attributes.content: But Juana got them to see what the real value of the deal was, and made them an offer they couldn't refuse.
attributes.name: Javier

attributes.content: This is different, Javier. Totally different.
attributes.name: Rus

attributes.content: Doesn't matter, Rus. She's our boss, and I'd say she's earned our trust.
attributes.name: Javier

attributes.content: She wants us to go back out to sea. You really going to back her on this? You really think this is a way forward?
attributes.name: Rus

attributes.content: 'Cause it's not. We're all just gonna end up in a watery grave.
attributes.name: Rus

attributes.content: Show a little faith. She found the compass, and a caster to fix it up. Everything's going to plan, no?
attributes.name: Javier

attributes.content: Even if you don't give a damn what happens outside your kitchen, you must've noticed the finshit you've been getting to cook with lately, yeah?
attributes.name: Rus

attributes.content: Look, here are the bills for the wood she's been buying up. All to fix those rotten old ships, all to head back out to that sea of hers.
attributes.name: Rus

attributes.content: You know how expensive wood is. All that coin could've made our lives much cozier. You wouldn't be slaving away every day pickling saltfin livers for garum, I can say that much.
attributes.name: Rus

attributes.content: Just go talk to her, afore she's done too much damage.
attributes.name: Rus

attributes.content: Been hearing some real nasty talk around town. Folks're getting restless.
attributes.name: Rus

attributes.content: Fine, I'll have a chat with her.
attributes.name: Javier

attributes.content: But don't forget, Rus. Without that 'loca' Juana, our grandparents, our parents, us...
attributes.name: Javier

attributes.content: None of us would've been able to live out here in the Salt Flat.
attributes.name: Javier

attributes.content: Strange...
attributes.name: Isidro

attributes.content: Where did that cook go? The one always sitting outside.
attributes.name: Isidro

attributes.content: Mierda...
attributes.name: Isidro

attributes.content: Are they trying to take me back?
attributes.name: Isidro

attributes.content: A man turns the corner, aggression apparent in his footsteps. Isidro quickly hides himself in a shadowy corner.
But the man walks right by him, swearing up a storm as he goes.
Idiots! You blasted idiots!
attributes.name: Aggressive Man

attributes.content: Just you wait and see, that puta's going to get us all killed!
attributes.name: Aggressive Man

attributes.content: Clear your head, Cesc. You've been eating that girl's herbs on the sly again.
attributes.name: Teach

attributes.content: My head's clear as day, it's yours I'm worried about!
attributes.name: Cesc

attributes.content: I can't be the only one with a problem with how she's leading us, can I?
attributes.name: Cesc

attributes.content: You're all just too yellow to say it. Cowards, the lot of you!
attributes.name: Cesc

attributes.content: Vete a la mierda. If you're going to spew shit, do it at home.
attributes.name: Teach

attributes.content: But am I wrong, Teach?!
attributes.name: Cesc

attributes.content: Don't tell me you trust that loca too?!
attributes.name: Cesc

attributes.content: Have you been taken in by her saltdamned lies too, like Javier?!
attributes.name: Cesc

attributes.content: Cesc...
attributes.name: Javier

attributes.content: Hey, cool it! He's just a little upset!
attributes.name: Rus

attributes.content: Say that again.
attributes.name: Javier

attributes.content: Say. That. Again.
attributes.name: Javier

attributes.content: You know I'm right, Javier.
attributes.name: Cesc

attributes.content: All those years of licking her boots. Shouting 'aye aye, Captain!' at all her shit.
attributes.name: Cesc

attributes.content: We all know you're a loyal beckbeast.
attributes.name: Cesc

attributes.content: So put down that knife of yours and go crying to MamÃ¡ like always.
attributes.name: Cesc

attributes.content: Youâ€”!
attributes.name: Javier

attributes.content: Javier grabs Cesc by the collar and lifts him up, slamming his back into the wall.
Javier's face is calm, but the fire in his eyes burns bright, nearly bright enough to sear holes into the target of his ire.
Are they going to start a fight...?
attributes.name: Isidro

attributes.content: If they do, I may as well make a break for it.
attributes.name: Isidro

attributes.content: Urk...
attributes.name: Cesc

attributes.content: Don't you ever spew that sort of finshit again. Not even in your sleep.
attributes.name: Javier

attributes.content: You hear me, Cesc?
attributes.name: Javier

attributes.content: Cesc can barely breathe as Javier presses into his neck. Nobody dares approach the two, only silently passing them with their heads lowered.
The people in the sheds lining the street shut their windows tight one after the other. In a flash, the street is empty.
Ugh...
attributes.name: Cesc

attributes.content: Let him go, Javier! He's learned his lesson!
attributes.name: Rus

attributes.content: (Whispers) Not here, Javier...
attributes.name: Teach

attributes.content: ANSWER ME!
attributes.name: Javier

attributes.content: (Nods furiously)
attributes.name: Cesc

attributes.content: *cough*... *cough* *cough* *cough*â€”!
attributes.name: Cesc

attributes.content: Now run along home, chaval. Remember what you learned today. Remember it well.
attributes.name: Javier

attributes.content: *Sigh* The hell was that, Javier? You've never been that reckless.
attributes.name: Teach

attributes.content: Reckless? No. He was just making it clear to everyone where he stands.
attributes.name: Rus

attributes.content: Rus, I...
attributes.name: Javier

attributes.content: Relax, just bring him a little something tonight. He'll accept your apology.
attributes.name: Teach

attributes.content: Yeah. Thanks, Teach.
attributes.name: Javier

attributes.content: Javier watches the woman walk away as he stands in the middle of the street.
A stray headscarf lies at his feet, having fallen off Cesc's head as he ran.
Javier picks it up, pats off the dust, and walks back to his shed, closing the door lightly behind him.
Good, everyone's gone.
attributes.name: Isidro

attributes.content: I was afraid I'd have to wait for them all to take an afternoon siesta.
attributes.name: Isidro

attributes.content: Tch...
attributes.name: Isidro

attributes.content: Why did I even try escaping at night last time? That's when these guys are most active.
attributes.name: Isidro

attributes.content: (There. That's my way out. Just need to head down.)
attributes.name: Isidro

attributes.content: (Only two guards. Gotta knock them out.)
attributes.name: Isidro

attributes.content: Ahem...
attributes.name: Inattentive Guard

attributes.content: Say, Anna... Ever thought about going someplace else?
attributes.name: Inattentive Guard

attributes.content: I kept some of those old coins we've been digging up. File off the king's face, and you can barely tell the difference from the new ones!
attributes.name: Inattentive Guard

attributes.content: We could leave the Flat behind. Go to Rim Billiton, Columbia... Anywhere you'd like.
attributes.name: Inattentive Guard

attributes.content: No, JosÃ©. I was born and raised here. Never even thought of leaving.
attributes.name: Diligent Guard

attributes.content: You really want to stay and follow the boss out to sea?
attributes.name: Inattentive Guard

attributes.content: She's the boss.
attributes.name: Diligent Guard

attributes.content: The sea'll swallow you up...
attributes.name: Inattentive Guard

attributes.content: I ain't afraid. She promised us.
attributes.name: Diligent Guard

attributes.content: Well, what scares me is that that promise might turn out to be a fleeting dream.
attributes.name: Inattentive Guard

attributes.content: If you're that scared, then go. I ain't gonna stop you.
attributes.name: Diligent Guard

attributes.content: ...I was kinda hoping you would.
attributes.name: Inattentive Guard

attributes.content: (Are they done yet?)
attributes.name: Isidro

attributes.content: If you don't wanna leave with me, then at least...
attributes.name: Inattentive Guard

attributes.content: At least what?
attributes.name: Diligent Guard

attributes.content: (Can't this guy take a hint?)
attributes.name: Isidro

attributes.content: Could you, uh, give me a...
attributes.name: Inattentive Guard

attributes.content: (Stop mumbling and spit it out alrâ€”)
attributes.name: Isidro

attributes.content: Stop mumbling and spit it out already!
attributes.name: Diligent Guard

attributes.content: Unable to bear watching the man stumble over his words any longer, the woman knocks him flat before sandwiching his face between her hands, kissing him hard.
Isidro furrows his brows before looking away politely.
Mmmf... Anna...
attributes.name: Inattentive Guard

attributes.content: Oh, just shut it!
attributes.name: Diligent Guard

attributes.content: (At least they didn't notice me.)
attributes.name: Isidro

attributes.content: Phew...
attributes.name: Isidro

attributes.content: Need to run faster... If I'm not out of here before dark...
attributes.name: Isidro

attributes.content: Based on the last few times, I'm definitely going to beâ€”
attributes.name: Isidro

attributes.content: A giant helm wheel rolls past his face before coming to a halt, stopping just short of crushing his feet.
You shouldn't keep a lady waiting, you know.
Now be a good boy and come back with me.
You shouldn't be here.
attributes.name: Isidro

attributes.content: Still not given up after all these attempts? We might not have enough spare medicine to patch you up if you end up wounded again, you know.
How did you know I was gone, SeÃ±ora Juana?
attributes.name: Isidro

attributes.content: I made sure nobody was following me.
attributes.name: Isidro

attributes.content: It's my job to be aware of what's happening in my fleet. You can't hide from my little eyes and ears.
attributes.name: Juana

attributes.content: Besides, did no one ever teach you not to ask a lady a question she'd rather not answer?
attributes.name: Juana

attributes.content: The young man does not reply, silently thinking of the sword that had been faithfully at his side for years. If he still had it, perhaps it would even the odds.
But it had shattered. Just like the freedom currently within arm's reach, it had died in these salt flats, snapped in two.
Isidro clenches his fist, grits his teeth, and grabs onto whatever is left of his things.
The lady lightly draws her sword, her stance relaxed.
Out of my way!
attributes.name: Isidro

attributes.content: Nghâ€”
attributes.name: Isidro

attributes.content: After a few sword strokes, the unarmed man falls defeated, face in the salty sand. He could not protect even the last of his belongings.
As Juana ties him up and heaves him over her shoulder, he feels something in his heart silently shatter.
Ah, youth. Never knowing when to give up. No matter how many times you're beaten down, you're already dreaming of the next attempt.
attributes.name: Juana

attributes.content: If you're that desperate to leave, then fix that compass for me.
attributes.name: Juana

attributes.content: How many times I have to say it? Only an alchemist can fix it, and I'm no alchemist!
attributes.name: Isidro

attributes.content: Oh? Then care to explain where that gold coin of yours came from?
attributes.name: Juana

attributes.content: ...I stole it.
attributes.name: Isidro

attributes.content: You are a terrible liar, joven.
attributes.name: Juana

attributes.content: On its face is a mark only a few know of: the mark of the long-lost school of alchemy. The knowledge they passed down helped countless fleets find treasure in the seas.
attributes.name: Juana

attributes.content: But after the Profound Silence, their disciples were imprisoned, and their works destroyed.
attributes.name: Juana

attributes.content: So tell me, why are you holding onto that coin, despite all that happened to them?
attributes.name: Juana

attributes.content: I don't know anything about any of that.
attributes.name: Isidro

attributes.content: Oh, what a stubborn young man. How about we change the question, then?
attributes.name: Juana

attributes.content: How did you dig that tunnel of yours?
attributes.name: Juana

attributes.content: ...The bread you gave me was really hard.
attributes.name: Isidro

attributes.content: What a clever boy.
attributes.name: Juana

attributes.content: My oh my, I really must thank you!
attributes.name: Juana

attributes.content: You've worked so hard keeping watch over him. Why, if you hadn't informed me right away, he might have actually gotten away.
attributes.name: Juana

attributes.content: Yes, I know, he's not the best-behaved prisoner, but that's why we have you, isn't it?
attributes.name: Juana

attributes.content: You really are our cleverest, sharpest-witted, most amazing little...
attributes.name: Juana

attributes.content: Nene.
attributes.name: Juana

attributes.content: Mm-ph!
attributes.name: Nene

attributes.content: (Spins excitedly)
attributes.name: Nene

attributes.content: Don't get too excited now. There are still many difficult duties ahead of you, and you mustn't take them lightly.
attributes.name: Juana

attributes.content: (Quickly falls flat on the ground)
attributes.name: Nene

attributes.content: I have faith in you, of course. Alright, off you go now. Don't let that boy learn who you are.
attributes.name: Juana

attributes.content: Mmph!
attributes.name: Nene

attributes.content: Come in, Javi.
attributes.name: Juana

attributes.content: Pardon me, SeÃ±ora Juana. I hope I'm not interrupting your time with Nene.
attributes.name: Javier

attributes.content: Mmph...
attributes.name: Nene

attributes.content: Don't give me that look. I've got a little something for you too.
attributes.name: Javier

attributes.content: My, what a fine little ball of bone... Did you carve it?
attributes.name: Juana

attributes.content: SÃ­. Out of bone shards that broke off some of our older weapons. Else they'd have gone to waste.
attributes.name: Javier

attributes.content: I wanted to give it to Rus as an apology, but he won't open his door for me.
attributes.name: Javier

attributes.content: Oh... I did hear about that. You shouldn't be so hasty, Javier. As our fleet's bosun, Rus has every right to question my plan to go out to sea.
attributes.name: Juana

attributes.content: And you attacking one of his men right in front of him can be seen as a rather harsh warning.
attributes.name: Juana

attributes.content: Considering your recent promotion to main chef, best keep a low profile. Some things are better left unsaid.
attributes.name: Juana

attributes.content: I think he's the one who needed that advice.
attributes.name: Javier

attributes.content: Just let him be, Javi. I don't pay it any mind, so why should you?
attributes.name: Juana

attributes.content: Because I know our boss isn't a madwoman playing around with other people's lives.
attributes.name: Javier

attributes.content: Well, aren't you sweet?
attributes.name: Juana

attributes.content: If we do get that compass fixed, can it really tell us how to avoid the sea monsters and find what we need?
attributes.name: Javier

attributes.content: Of course. I would never lie to you, Javi.
attributes.name: Juana

attributes.content: The Salt Flat won't be able to support us for generations to come. While the sea is a nigh inexhaustible font of resources.
attributes.name: Juana

attributes.content: Now that we have both the 'compass' and an alchemist to fix it, this is a chance for us to turn our lives around. We can't afford to miss it.
attributes.name: Juana

attributes.content: But aside from you, none of us have even seen the sea, or experienced that age of gold and plenty.
attributes.name: Javier

attributes.content: I've been living in the Flat for as long as I can remember, but the old cook said that only a century ago, this was fertile soil.
attributes.name: Javier

attributes.content: What if that bountiful sea of yours has already become just as barren as the Flat after the Profound Silence?
attributes.name: Javier

attributes.content: And this magic compass of yours... can't guide us back to the past.
attributes.name: Javier

attributes.content: 'The tides will wash away my footprints, and the wind will scrub away the foam from the waves.'
attributes.name: Juana

attributes.content: 'But the sea and the shore will stand, forevermore.'
attributes.name: Juana

attributes.content: What...?
attributes.name: Javier

attributes.content: Just an old poem, Javi. Unlike the land, the sea is tenacious. Though it may be infested with strangely fleshed beasts, it is still abundant with precious lifelines, waiting for us to find them.
attributes.name: Juana

attributes.content: It was once ours, and it can be ours once again.
attributes.name: Juana

attributes.content: I want to believe you, I do.
attributes.name: Javier

attributes.content: But these rumors... You have to prove yourself in front of everyone, show them you're not talking nonsense.
attributes.name: Javier

attributes.content: I will.
attributes.name: Juana

attributes.content: Oh, right. I did as you asked and went by the shed. There really is a hole in there. I'll fill it up tonight.
attributes.name: Javier

attributes.content: What should we do about the boy? He can't stay there anymore.
attributes.name: Javier

attributes.content: Don't worry, I've already found a place for him.
attributes.name: Juana

attributes.content: But where? If you mean my place, then no.
attributes.name: Javier

attributes.content: Don't you worry your little head over it. You'll see on your way home.
attributes.name: Juana

attributes.content: Damned little brat, this peg-leg you sold me is pure garbage! Two days and it's already split in twain!
attributes.name: Angry Man

attributes.content: Eh, it just needs a bit of spit, polish, and glue and it'll be good as new.
attributes.name: Conniving Vendor

attributes.content: You sack of finshit, how about I rip your leg off and use that instead?!
attributes.name: Angry Man

attributes.content: H-Hey, settle down now! I'll take the leg back, no need to get violent!
attributes.name: Conniving Vendor

attributes.content: I-I-I've got a knife! Don't come any closer!
attributes.name: Conniving Vendor

attributes.content: Javier! Right on time! Help me catch the little wench!
attributes.name: Angry Man

attributes.content: Out of my way, idiot!
attributes.name: Conniving Vendor

attributes.content: Tch... Troublemaker.
attributes.name: Javier

attributes.content: Ow! That hurts!
attributes.name: Conniving Vendor

attributes.content: Give him back his money.
attributes.name: Javier

attributes.content: Let me go! I'll tell Juana you've been bullying me!
attributes.name: Conniving Vendor

attributes.content: Use your head, chica. This isn't somewhere you can run your mouth. We're not like those cowards in other towns.
attributes.name: Javier

attributes.content: If you mess with us, we won't bother locking you up or putting you on trial. Left hand or right hand? Choose the one you want to keep.
attributes.name: Javier

attributes.content: H-How dare you! If it weren't for me, your boss would never have gotten ahold of that compass!
attributes.name: Conniving Vendor

attributes.content: Care to try your luck?
attributes.name: Javier

attributes.content: Err... Fine, I'll return the money! But you gotta give me back that peg-leg!
attributes.name: Conniving Vendor

attributes.content: Not on my life. If it's stuck to my leg, it's mine.
attributes.name: Angry Man

attributes.content: Y-You're no better than a pack of bandits!
attributes.name: Conniving Vendor

attributes.content: I'm glad you've finally come to an accurate assessment of us, seÃ±orita.
attributes.name: Javier

attributes.content: Haha... Slip of the tongue is all... Here, the money. And, uh, adios.
attributes.name: Conniving Vendor

attributes.content: What was the boss thinking, letting a dastardly little girl like that aboard our crew?
attributes.name: Angry Man

attributes.content: She's got her reasons.
attributes.name: Javier

attributes.content: I heard that kid ran off again. Why not just break his legs and be done with it?
attributes.name: Angry Man

attributes.content: And now she's gone and strung him up here, ordering us not to touch a hair on his head. Seeing that grumpy face of his pisses me right off. You don't know how much I wanna give it a good punch.
attributes.name: Angry Man

attributes.content: Hey, don't go, Javier! I was just thinking out loud!
attributes.name: Angry Man

attributes.content: Hey!
attributes.name: Angry Man

attributes.content: You've been running around all day. Want some water?
attributes.name: Javier

attributes.content: Cloudbeast got your tongue?
attributes.name: Javier

attributes.content: I won't surrender to you lot.
attributes.name: Isidro

attributes.content: If that's how you want it, chaval.
attributes.name: Javier

attributes.content: Just here to give you the bad news. I'm afraid you're going to be out here like this all night.
attributes.name: Javier

attributes.content: ...Whatever. I don't care.
attributes.name: Isidro

attributes.content: Good to hear.
attributes.name: Javier

attributes.content: The dawn light falls upon the coin, and a stray ray reflects onto Isidro's eyelid, causing him to blink. The light wanders, and the circular marking on the coin begins to ripple.
He begins to feel discomfort and hands the coin to the man ashore, though the man is in no hurry to receive it. Instead, he grabs onto Isidro's legs and lifts him up by the feet.
The boy struggles, and the man ashore begins to speak:

attributes.text: 'If you have nowhere to go, my young friend, you can come with me.'
'They call me Aulus, and you have my thanks for finding my coin.'

attributes.content: The rays of the setting sun seep through the cracks of the salt ship's frame, shining onto Isidro's eyelid. He blinks in discomfort.
People walk by, and none can resist snickering at him as they pass.
He feels a little dizzy. The faint laughter causes his cheeks to flush, though it might just be an effect of being hung upside down.
Out here in the Salt Flat, simple tents and ramshackle shacks are put up one after the other.
Enormous salt ships are berthed on either side of the road, like a herd of slumbering seabeasts.
Upon their masts hang great sacks for gathering rainwater, flapping in the wind as they await clouds to pass overhead.
Upon the road, people walk shoulder to shoulder, laughing and squabbling, until all of a sudden a quarrel breaks out, which soon escalates into a chaotic all-out brawl.
And in the quieter corners, some are pulling their lovers in close for an intimate kiss.
These guys really are a bunch of barbarians.
attributes.name: Conniving Vendor

attributes.content: Why'd I'd even come to such a lousy place?
attributes.name: Conniving Vendor

attributes.content: Good question, Pascuala. How did I end up in this den of thieves?
attributes.name: Isidro

attributes.content: *Cough* *Cough*
attributes.name: Pascuala

attributes.content: Not too sure myself...
attributes.name: Pascuala
